Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class HTMLStyler

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.HTMLStyler
Direct Known Subclasses:
CSSStyler
public class HTMLStyler extends Object
Creates HTML from source code content. A styler processes source code using a Tokenizer and produces HTML content that displays the code with highlighting, similar to how it would appear in a JSourceCodeEditor. This class will create HTML with inline CSS styles using the style attribute. To create HTML markup that uses CSS classes, see CSSStyler.
Since:
2.1

    • styleLine

      public String styleLine​(String line, int lineNumber)
      Styles a document incrementally, a line at a time. This allows you obtain individual HTML fragments for each line.
      Parameters:
      line - the text of the line to style
      lineNumber - the line number index (lines must be styled in order)
      Returns:
      the styled HTML

    • styleLineImpl

      protected void styleLineImpl​(StringBuilder dest, String line, int lineNumber)
      Creates styled HTML content for a line by processing a single line and appending the result to a StringBuilder.
      Parameters:
      dest - the buffer to append the result to
      line - the text of the line to style
      lineNumber - the line number index of the line

    • openStyle

      protected void openStyle​(StringBuilder b, TokenType type)
      Appends the tags needed to start a new token type so that the subsequent document text is styled appropriately.
      Parameters:
      b - the buffer to append to
      type - the type of token to insert style tags for
      See Also:
